medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The older brother developed chronic constipation upon introducing solid foods around age 2. His condition worsened over time, leading to growth failure despite remaining active. He experienced acute volvulus of the large intestine at age 14, requiring right hemicolectomy, followed by small bowel obstruction, with subsequent partial resection and ileostomy. The younger brother developed PIPO at age 6, with a similar course, also experiencing acute volvulus and requiring surgery, becoming TPN-dependent around age 14. Both brothers are mostly dependent on TPN for nutrition, with some tolerance for oral food intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The older brother has a history of chronic constipation, acute volvulus, small bowel obstruction, and dependence on TPN. The younger brother has a history of PIPO, acute volvulus, small bowel obstruction, and vitamin D deficiency. Both brothers were treated with pyridostigmine. The younger brother has a history of central-line-related thrombosis.
medical_history.family_history: The mother, maternal aunts, and maternal grandmother have had severe childhood-onset constipation requiring large amounts of laxatives. The father had chronic diarrhea and nephrolithiasis, and died at age 50 due to lung cancer.
